Class: BaseThree

component/BaseThree~ BaseThree

new BaseThree(materialopt, geometryopt, typeopt)

Every Object in the engine that can be rendered on screen should extend this class. It uses Three.js resources, encapsulating an object compatible with the engine in a transparent manner.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
material THREE.Material <optional>
 Material from Three.js
geometry THREE.Geometry <optional>
 Geometry from Three.js
type Number <optional>
 component type
Source:
  • component/BaseThree.js, line 8

hide()

  • component/BaseThree.js, line 212

rotateAroundObjectAxis(axisopt, radiansopt)

Rotate an object around an arbitrary axis in world space (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/11060734/how-to-rotate-a-3d-object-on-axis-three-js)
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
axis THREE.Vector3 <optional>
 The reference axis for rotation
radians Number <optional>
 radian degrees to rotate
Source:
  • component/BaseThree.js, line 176
Example
// rotation of 90 degrees on the x-axis
var xAxis = new THREE.Vector3(1,0,0);
rotateAroundWorldAxis( xAxis, Math.PI / 180);

rotateAroundObjectAxis(axisopt, radiansopt)

Rotate an object around an arbitrary axis in object space (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/11060734/how-to-rotate-a-3d-object-on-axis-three-js)
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
axis THREE.Vector3 <optional>
 The reference axis for rotation
radians Number <optional>
 radian degrees to rotate
